author: S Sundar
text:
In a shocking incident, a Plus Two student, R. Umamaheswari (17), was hacked by an unidentified youth here on Monday afternoon. The condition of the girl, admitted to a private hospital in Madurai, is said to be very serious.

Police said that the victim, daughter of a woman Special Sub-Inspector of Police, Kasiammal, was returning home after appearing for the public examination at Hindu Higher Secondary School in the town.

The girl was studying in Computer Science stream at Valluvar Vidhyalaya Higher Secondary School.

While Umamaheswari was walking along with two other girls towards her home at the Police Quarters, the youth approached her. Suddenly, he pulled out a machete and started attacking her in West Mada Street around 1.30 p.m.

She sustained multiple cut injuries on her neck, head and hand and her school uniform was drenched with blood. She was rushed to the Government Hospital here where she was administered first-aid before being referred to a private hospital in Madurai.

Superintendent of Police P. Aravindhan said that the police were following some suspects. “Only after getting statement from the girl, can we proceed further,” he said. Srivilliputtur Town police have registered a case of attempt to murder.

Deputy Superintendent of Police (Srivilliputtur) R. Venugopal said that recently, the police had warned a local youth for harassing the girl. He had given an undertaking that he would not stalk the girl any more.
title: Plus Two girl hacked in Srivillputtur
